error.signature: Error: Route "/X" used params.id. params should be awaited before using its properties.
error.regex: params should be awaited before using its properties

verdict.summary: Breaking change in Next.js 15: params and searchParams are now Promises and must be awaited. The Next.js codemod can auto-migrate all pages and layouts.

dead_ends.action: Destructuring params in the function signature as in Next.js 14
dead_ends.why_fails: In Next.js 15, params is a Promise. Destructuring ({ params: { id } }) gives the Promise object properties, not the resolved values. The code runs without type errors but id is undefined at runtime.
dead_ends.common_misconception: The Next.js 14 pattern of synchronous params destructuring still works in Next.js 15. It does not — params is now async.

dead_ends.action: Using React.use(params) in a server component
dead_ends.why_fails: React.use() is designed for client components to unwrap promises during render. In server components, use standard await instead. Using React.use in a server component may cause a different error or unexpected behavior.
dead_ends.common_misconception: React.use() is a universal Promise unwrapper. It is specifically for the client-side React rendering model.

workarounds.action: Await params at the top of the page/layout function
workarounds.how: Change: export default function Page({ params }: { params: { id: string } }) to: export default async function Page({ params }: { params: Promise<{ id: string }> }) { const { id } = await params; ... }. Apply the same pattern to searchParams.
workarounds.tradeoff: Page function must be async; cannot use hooks directly (but server components cannot use hooks anyway)

workarounds.action: Update the type to Promise<T> for TypeScript type safety
workarounds.how: Change params: { id: string } to params: Promise<{ id: string }>. This makes TypeScript catch any synchronous access to params properties at compile time. Apply to both params and searchParams.
workarounds.tradeoff: None; this is the correct type for Next.js 15

workarounds.action: Use the Next.js codemod for automated migration
workarounds.how: Run: npx @next/codemod@latest next-async-request-api . This automatically migrates all pages, layouts, and route handlers to the async params/searchParams pattern. Review changes after running.
workarounds.tradeoff: May need manual review for complex page components
